verses.kjv: And he heard the words of Laban’s sons, saying, Jacob hath taken away all that was our father’s; and of that which was our father’s hath he gotten all this glory.
verses.ct: Jacob learned that Laban's sons were saying, "Jacob has taken everything that belonged to our father. All his wealth has come from what was our father's."

verses.kjv: And Jacob beheld the countenance of Laban, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.
verses.ct: Jacob also noticed that Laban's attitude toward him had changed and was no longer favorable like it used to be.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Jacob, Return unto the land of thy fathers, and to thy kindred; and I will be with thee.
verses.ct: The LORD told Jacob, "Go back to the land where your fathers lived, to your relatives, and I will be with you."

verses.kjv: And Jacob sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto his flock,
verses.ct: So Jacob sent a message to Rachel and Leah, asking them to come out to the field where his flock was.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, I see your father’s countenance, that it is not toward me as before; but the God of my father hath been with me.
verses.ct: He told them, "I can see that your father's attitude toward me is not what it once was. But the God of my father has been with me."

verses.kjv: And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.
verses.ct: "You both know that I have worked for your father with all my strength."

verses.kjv: And your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; but God suffered him not to hurt me.
verses.ct: "Yet your father has cheated me and altered my wages ten times. But God did not allow him to harm me."

verses.kjv: If he said thus, The speckled shall be thy wages; then all the cattle bare speckled: and if he said thus, The ringstraked shall be thy hire; then bare all the cattle ringstraked.
verses.ct: "Whenever he would say, 'The speckled ones will be your payment,' then all the animals would produce speckled offspring. When he would say, 'The streaked ones will be your payment,' then all the animals would produce streaked offspring."

verses.kjv: Thus God hath taken away the cattle of your father, and given them to me.
verses.ct: "In this way, God has taken your father's livestock and given them to me."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the time that the cattle conceived, that I lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the rams which leaped upon the cattle were ringstraked, speckled, and grisled.
verses.ct: "During the breeding season, I had a dream in which I looked up and saw that the male goats mating with the flock were streaked, speckled, and spotted."

verses.kjv: And the angel of God spake unto me in a dream, saying, Jacob: And I said, Here am I.
verses.ct: "The angel of God spoke to me in that dream, saying, 'Jacob.' I replied, 'Here I am.'"

verses.kjv: And he said, Lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the rams which leap upon the cattle are ringstraked, speckled, and grisled: for I have seen all that Laban doeth unto thee.
verses.ct: "He said, 'Look up and observe that all the male goats mating with the flock are streaked, speckled, and spotted, because I have seen everything that Laban has been doing to you.'"

verses.kjv: I am the God of Bethel, where thou anointedst the pillar, and where thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy kindred.
verses.ct: "'I am the God of Bethel, where you poured oil on the pillar and where you made a vow to me. Now get up, leave this land, and go back to the land of your relatives.'"

verses.kjv: And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father’s house?
verses.ct: Rachel and Leah responded, "Do we still have any share or inheritance in our father's household?"

verses.kjv: Are we not counted of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath quite devoured also our money.
verses.ct: "Doesn't he treat us like outsiders? He sold us and has completely used up the money paid for us."

verses.kjv: For all the riches which God hath taken from our father, that is ours, and our children’s: now then, whatsoever God hath said unto thee, do.
verses.ct: "All the wealth that God has taken from our father really belongs to us and our children. So do whatever God has told you to do."

verses.kjv: Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels;
verses.ct: Jacob got ready to leave, placing his children and wives on camels.

verses.kjv: And he carried away all his cattle, and all his goods which he had gotten, the cattle of his getting, which he had gotten in Padanaram, for to go to Isaac his father in the land of Canaan.
verses.ct: He drove all his livestock ahead of him and took along all the possessions he had accumulated—the livestock he had acquired in Padanaram—to travel to his father Isaac in the land of Canaan.

verses.kjv: And Laban went to shear his sheep: and Rachel had stolen the images that were her father’s.
verses.ct: While Laban had gone to shear his sheep, Rachel stole her father's household idols.

verses.kjv: And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he fled.
verses.ct: Jacob deceived Laban the Syrian by not telling him that he was leaving.

verses.kjv: So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and passed over the river, and set his face toward the mount Gilead.
verses.ct: He fled with everything he owned, crossing the river and heading toward the hill country of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob was fled.
verses.ct: On the third day, Laban was informed that Jacob had fled.

verses.kjv: And he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days’ journey; and they overtook him in the mount Gilead.
verses.ct: Taking his relatives with him, Laban chased after Jacob for seven days and caught up with him in the hill country of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And God came to Laban the Syrian in a dream by night, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
verses.ct: But God appeared to Laban the Syrian in a dream that night and warned him, "Be careful not to say anything to Jacob, whether good or bad."

verses.kjv: Then Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mount: and Laban with his brethren pitched in the mount of Gilead.
verses.ct: Laban caught up with Jacob, who had set up his tent in the hill country. Laban and his relatives also camped in the hill country of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my daughters, as captives taken with the sword?
verses.ct: Laban confronted Jacob, "What have you done? You slipped away without my knowledge and carried off my daughters like prisoners of war!"

verses.kjv: Wherefore didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp?
verses.ct: "Why did you run away in secret and deceive me? Why didn't you tell me so I could have sent you off with celebration, with singing, with tambourines, and with harps?"

verses.kjv: And hast not suffered me to kiss my sons and my daughters? thou hast now done foolishly in so doing.
verses.ct: "You didn't even let me kiss my grandchildren and my daughters goodbye! You have acted foolishly."

verses.kjv: It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the God of your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, Take thou heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
verses.ct: "I have the power to do you harm, but the God of your father spoke to me last night, saying, 'Be careful not to say anything to Jacob, whether good or bad.'"

verses.kjv: And now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou sore longedst after thy father’s house, yet wherefore hast thou stolen my gods?
verses.ct: "I understand that you left because you desperately longed to return to your father's household. But why did you steal my gods?"

verses.kjv: And Jacob answered and said to Laban, Because I was afraid: for I said, Peradventure thou wouldest take by force thy daughters from me.
verses.ct: Jacob answered Laban, "I left secretly because I was afraid. I thought you might take your daughters away from me by force."

verses.kjv: With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee. For Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.
verses.ct: "As for your gods, if you find them with anyone here, that person will not live. In front of our relatives, examine everything I have and take back whatever is yours." Jacob did not know that Rachel had stolen them.

verses.kjv: And Laban went into Jacob’s tent, and into Leah’s tent, and into the two maidservants’ tents; but he found them not. Then went he out of Leah’s tent, and entered into Rachel’s tent.
verses.ct: Laban went and searched Jacob's tent, then Leah's tent, and then the tents of the two female servants, but he did not find them. After leaving Leah's tent, he went into Rachel's tent.

verses.kjv: Now Rachel had taken the images, and put them in the camel’s furniture, and sat upon them. And Laban searched all the tent, but found them not.
verses.ct: Rachel had taken the household idols and hidden them inside the camel's saddle, and she was sitting on them. Laban searched the entire tent but could not find them.

verses.kjv: And she said to her father, Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise up before thee; for the custom of women is upon me. And he searched, but found not the images.
verses.ct: She said to her father, "Please don't be angry, my lord, that I am unable to stand up in your presence. I am having my monthly period." So he searched but did not find the idols.

verses.kjv: And Jacob was wroth, and chode with Laban: and Jacob answered and said to Laban, What is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast so hotly pursued after me?
verses.ct: Then Jacob became angry and confronted Laban. He demanded, "What wrong have I done? What is my sin that you have pursued me so aggressively?"

verses.kjv: Whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household stuff? set it here before my brethren and thy brethren, that they may judge betwixt us both.
verses.ct: "You have gone through all my belongings—what have you found that belongs to your household? Place it here in front of my relatives and yours, and let them decide between the two of us."

verses.kjv: This twenty years have I been with thee; thy ewes and thy she goats have not cast their young, and the rams of thy flock have I not eaten.
verses.ct: "For twenty years I have been with you. Your female sheep and goats never lost their young, and I never ate the rams from your flock."

verses.kjv: That which was torn of beasts I brought not unto thee; I bare the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day, or stolen by night.
verses.ct: "When an animal was killed by wild beasts, I never brought it to you as an excuse. I bore the loss myself. You demanded payment from me for every stolen animal, whether taken during the day or at night."

verses.kjv: Thus I was; in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from mine eyes.
verses.ct: "This is how it was for me: the scorching heat consumed me during the day, and the freezing cold at night, and sleep fled from my eyes."

verses.kjv: Thus have I been twenty years in thy house; I served thee fourteen years for thy two daughters, and six years for thy cattle: and thou hast changed my wages ten times.
verses.ct: "This is how I spent twenty years in your household. I worked fourteen years for your two daughters and six years for your livestock, and you changed my wages ten times."

verses.kjv: Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac, had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away now empty. God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.
verses.ct: "If the God of my father—the God of Abraham and the one Isaac fears—had not been on my side, you would certainly have sent me away with nothing. God saw my suffering and the hard work of my hands, and he rebuked you last night."

verses.kjv: And Laban answered and said unto Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, and these children are my children, and these cattle are my cattle, and all that thou seest is mine: and what can I do this day unto these my daughters, or unto their children which they have born?
verses.ct: Laban replied to Jacob, "These women are my daughters, these children are my grandchildren, these flocks are my flocks—everything you see belongs to me. Yet what can I do today about my own daughters or the children they have given birth to?"

verses.kjv: Now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.
verses.ct: "So come, let us make a covenant, you and I, and let it serve as a testimony between us."

verses.kjv: And Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.
verses.ct: Jacob picked up a stone and set it upright as a pillar.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones, and made an heap: and they did eat there upon the heap.
verses.ct: Then Jacob told his relatives, "Collect stones." So they gathered stones and made a pile, and they ate a meal there beside the pile.

verses.kjv: And Laban called it Jegarsahadutha: but Jacob called it Galeed.
verses.ct: Laban named the place Jegarsahadutha, but Jacob named it Galeed.

verses.kjv: And Laban said, This heap is a witness between me and thee this day. Therefore was the name of it called Galeed;
verses.ct: Laban declared, "This pile of stones is a testimony between you and me today." That is why it was named Galeed.

verses.kjv: And Mizpah; for he said, The LORD watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another.
verses.ct: It was also called Mizpah, because Laban said, "May the LORD keep watch between you and me when we are separated from each other."

verses.kjv: If thou shalt afflict my daughters, or if thou shalt take other wives beside my daughters, no man is with us; see, God is witness betwixt me and thee.
verses.ct: "If you mistreat my daughters or marry other women in addition to my daughters, even though no one else is around to see, remember that God is a witness between you and me."

verses.kjv: And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have cast betwixt me and thee:
verses.ct: Laban also said to Jacob, "Look at this pile of stones and look at this pillar that I have placed between us."

verses.kjv: This heap be witness, and this pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar unto me, for harm.
verses.ct: "This pile is a testimony, and this pillar is a testimony, that I will not cross beyond this pile toward you, and you will not cross beyond this pile and this pillar toward me, to cause harm."

verses.kjv: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge betwixt us. And Jacob sware by the fear of his father Isaac.
verses.ct: "May the God of Abraham and the God of Nahor—the God of their father—judge between us." Jacob took his oath in the name of the one his father Isaac feared.

verses.kjv: Then Jacob offered sacrifice upon the mount, and called his brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mount.
verses.ct: Jacob then offered a sacrifice on the mountain and invited his relatives to share a meal. They ate together and spent the night on the mountain.

verses.kjv: And early in the morning Laban rose up, and kissed his sons and his daughters, and blessed them: and Laban departed, and returned unto his place.
verses.ct: Early the next morning, Laban got up, kissed his grandchildren and daughters, and blessed them. Then Laban left and went back home.
